name: CreateSelfHostedRunnerGroup
description:
Create a self-hosted runner group for an enterprise.

Use this tool to create a new self-hosted runner group for an enterprise on GitHub. Requires authentication with an access token having the `manage_runners:enterprise` scope.

parameters.name: enterprise_name_or_id
parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name or the enterprise ID to identify the enterprise.

value_schema.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

parameters.name: runner_group_name
parameters.description: Name of the runner group to be created.

parameters.name: runner_ids
parameters.description: List of runner IDs to be added to the new runner group.

value_schema.description: List of runner IDs to add to the runner group.

parameters.name: organization_ids_for_access
parameters.description: List of IDs for organizations allowed to access the runner group.

value_schema.description: List of organization IDs that can access the runner group.

parameters.name: workflows_allowed_for_runner_group
parameters.description: List of workflows the runner group can run. Ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is `true`.

value_schema.description: List of workflows the runner group should be allowed to run. This setting will be ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is set to `true`.

parameters.name: runner_group_visibility
parameters.description: Specifies the visibility of the runner group: 'selected' for individual organizations or 'all' for all organizations.

value_schema.description: Visibility of a runner group. You can select all organizations or select individual organization.

parameters.name: allow_public_repository_use
parameters.description: Set to true to allow the runner group to be used by public repositories.

value_schema.description: Whether the runner group can be used by `public` repositories.

parameters.name: restrict_to_selected_workflows
parameters.description: Set to true to restrict the runner group to only the workflows in 'selected_workflows'.

value_schema.description: If `true`, the runner group will be restricted to running only the workflows specified in the `selected_workflows` array.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: enterprise
parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

value_schema.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

parameters.name: allows_public_repositories
parameters.description: Whether the runner group can be used by `public` repositories.

value_schema.description: Whether the runner group can be used by `public` repositories.

parameters.name: restricted_to_workflows
parameters.description: If `true`, the runner group will be restricted to running only the workflows specified in the `selected_workflows` array.

value_schema.description: If `true`, the runner group will be restricted to running only the workflows specified in the `selected_workflows` array.

parameters.name: runners
parameters.description: List of runner IDs to add to the runner group.

value_schema.description: List of runner IDs to add to the runner group.

parameters.name: selected_organization_ids
parameters.description: List of organization IDs that can access the runner group.

value_schema.description: List of organization IDs that can access the runner group.

parameters.name: selected_workflows
parameters.description: List of workflows the runner group should be allowed to run. This setting will be ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is set to `true`.

value_schema.description: List of workflows the runner group should be allowed to run. This setting will be ignored unless `restricted_to_workflows` is set to `true`.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: Visibility of a runner group. You can select all organizations or select individual organization.

value_schema.description: Visibility of a runner group. You can select all organizations or select individual organization.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
